author: Staff Reporter
text:
Collector K.Vivekanandan at a consultative meeting with line departments at the Collectoratein Dharmapuri.

Election officials here have been advised to steer focus on increasing voter turnout in pockets that had witnessed poor turnout in the last elections.

A consultative meeting with the line departments was held here at the Collectorate under the aegis of Collector K.Vivekanandan on Thursday.

To ensure voting by first time voters, a voter segment largely constituted of students, the Collector asked the departments to conduct special rallies focussing on voter awareness among college students.

In a bid to target voters, focus will be on polling booths that had witnessed relatively poor voter turnout in the five Assembly constituencies in the last election.

The line departments have been asked to put up banners extolling voting as a right, in all government offices.

Election officials have been advised to launch extensive signature campaign and oath taking rallies.

Also, colleges will be roped in to spread the message of voting.
title: ‘Focus on increasing voter turnout’
